head.title: How to contribute to Phenomic
head.description:
Update the boilerplate

To work on the boilerplate, run the following:

Update the docs

To work on the docs, run the following:

Work onâ€¦

body:
#Update the boilerplate

To work on the boilerplate, run the following:

$ npm run boilerplate-start

#Update the docs

To work on the docs, run the following:

$ npm run docs-start

#Work on the core

Every core files are in src/. Tests are located relative to modules. For every modification, please run the entire test suit by using npm test.

But when you are working on a specific component, to work faster, just be focused on what you are interested on.

#Example with PageContainer

If you want to work on PageContainer, look in src/PageContainer. Tests will be in src/PageContainer/__tests__/*.

To run test for PageContainer component:

$ ava src/PageContainer/__tests__/*
rawBody:
## Update the boilerplate

To work on the boilerplate, run the following:

```console
$ npm run boilerplate-start
```

## Update the docs

To work on the docs, run the following:

```console
$ npm run docs-start
```

## Work on the core

Every core files are in `src/`. Tests are located relative to modules.
For every modification, please run the entire test suit by using `npm test`.

But when you are working on a specific component, to work faster, just be
focused on what you are interested on.

### Example with PageContainer

If you want to work on ``PageContainer``, look in ``src/PageContainer``.
Tests will be in ``src/PageContainer/__tests__/*``.

To run test for ``PageContainer`` component:

```console
$ ava src/PageContainer/__tests__/*
```
raw:
---
title: "How to contribute to Phenomic"
---

## Update the boilerplate

To work on the boilerplate, run the following:

```console
$ npm run boilerplate-start
```

## Update the docs

To work on the docs, run the following:

```console
$ npm run docs-start
```

## Work on the core

Every core files are in `src/`. Tests are located relative to modules.
For every modification, please run the entire test suit by using `npm test`.

But when you are working on a specific component, to work faster, just be
focused on what you are interested on.

### Example with PageContainer

If you want to work on ``PageContainer``, look in ``src/PageContainer``.
Tests will be in ``src/PageContainer/__tests__/*``.

To run test for ``PageContainer`` component:

```console
$ ava src/PageContainer/__tests__/*
```
